lines.text: Lily! Can't you see that I was just trying to get us something passable to eat?
Yeah, and I'm Wyatt Earp.
Can I have a kiss, Wyatt Earp?
Don't you go puckering up to me, Eileen.
Oh come on, come on.
[about French]
It's the language of love.
I didn't know the language of love had words, ma'am.
Oh my, yes. I could teach you.
The population of the United States is over 63 million people now.
They sure ain't here.
Sawmill?
We sold our bodies, why couldn't we sell some wood?
Every tree is known by its fruit. This woman has brought forth bad fruit.
Sorry, son, the only female I seen in the last month is that mare over there. And she's starting to look pretty good to me, how about to you?
What's your name?
Lilly.
Just Lilly?
Lilly's enough.
Well if you answer to it...
Well, that depends on who's asking.

[about to hang Cody]
I accuse you of harlotry! I accuse you of having a scorpion between your legs that seduces men! I accuse you...
Just get on with it, will ya?
I don't have a lot of money, but I've got this land, and I swear I'll never break your heart.
If your laws don't include me, well then, they don't apply to me either.
Eileen, you don't have to throw yourself at the first old fart that comes along.
Pick it up. Put it in. Die like a man.
You're dead! I just ain't killed you yet.
If you were anything more than a pile of manure with a badge on it, my Colonel might still be alive.
It's not like I put a gun to your mister's head and made him jump that whore... bitch!
Ma'am, I don't know how to tell you this...
Tell me what?
Well, your claim is worthless without your husband alive. See for yourself... second paragraph. Now ma'am, I'm sorry but it's the law. Surely you understand that.
Yes, I understand that. I was worthless until I married. So now, I guess I'm worthless as a widow. Funny, I had some value as a whore.
Are we going to find another saloon or what?
I'm finished with that.
Me too.
It takes money. Building a sawmill takes money.
I know, I'm probably just dreaming, but it's the closest thing to a plan we've got right now.
Well, it could be that I got some... in Agua Dulce. Been wiring money there for years; over $12,000 by now.
Are we going to get Eileen out or what?
How?
I don't know, but we got you out when they were gonna lynch you.
Well now, that was lucky.
Look here, I don't let my friends get hung.
Cody! Cody! Help!
Leave her alone, Colonel.
I paid for a goddamned birthday kiss, and I'm gonna get it!
You touch her again and you're a dead man.
[Colonel shoots twice at Cody, she shoots him in the chest]
Hey girlie, how about old Ned unties you and we can have some fun, eh?
Well, then you better kill me first, because the only way I'd lay with you would be if I was dead.
Once the money gets back to Agua Dulce I reckon you're going to be pretty big heroes in these parts.
We ain't heroes.

[about Eileen]
You'll see her again.
It ain't likely.

[to Lily]
I love you all the way to the moon and back, that's never going to change.

[Anita rides off]
Where's she going?
Probably just riding off the anger.
She picked a fine time to have a fit. If it were she in trouble, Lily would be the first one to help her.
I want to buy a dress.
And what kind of dress did you have in mind?
Oh one of them ready to wear kinds like you see in the Sears catelouge.
I really think a woman like you would be happier shopping elsewhere.
[Cody grabs him and holds her gun to him]
They put Pinkertons on your trail, you best keep moving.
Do I look like a criminal type?
No ma'am, you don't.

Law of the land was the cattle could roam whever they wanted to. See that barbed wire? It gave ranchers like Tucker a chance to start out without being overrun by the cattle of the big outfits. You know, people say the West was conquered by the railroads. Uh-uh, my daddy says it's conquered by barbed wire.
You sure a know a lot about this for a fine southern lady from New Orleans.
Ah Lily, I ain't from New Orleans, I lied to Ben. I grew up on an East Texas grub farm not unlike this one.
She ain't coming back.
She will.
I'm going to get Eileen now, are you coming?
If Cody comes back and we're not here.
Don't worry, she'll wait.
Cody? Kiss my sister's black cat's ass. What're you doing here?
I'm making a withdrawal.
So are we, how much?
[Cody gestures to the $12,000 the banker has]
Well, give the lady her money, fat man.
What'd that reward be?
Five hundred dollars - wired to you when we get her. My word as a Pekerton Detenctive.
Five hundred's more than I'm used to. All right. I seen that whore Cody ridin' upriver not an hour ago.
Well hell, why didn't you do somethin'?
She's with Kid Jarrett.
Hey, you sure it were Kid Jarrett?
Yeah, sure enough. I'd a done somethin' too, but I ain't no Pekerton Detenctive.
